metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Margins
Margins are used to create space around elements, outside of any defined borders.
content.html: Margins are used to create space around elements, outside of any defined borders.

content.text: CSS Margins
The CSS margin properties are used to create space around elements, outside of any defined borders.
content.html: The CSS margin properties are used to create space around elements, outside of any defined borders.

content.text: With CSS, you have full control over the margins. There are properties for setting the margin for each side of an element (top, right, bottom, and left).
content.html: With CSS, you have full control over the margins. There are properties for setting the margin for each side of an element (top, right, bottom, and left).

content.text: Margin - Individual Sides
CSS has properties for specifying the margin for each side of an element:
content.html: CSS has properties for specifying the margin for each side of an element:

content.text: All the margin properties can have the following values:
content.html: All the margin properties can have the following values:

content.text: Tip: Negative values are allowed.

content.code_html:
p {
  margin-top: 100px;
  margin-bottom: 100px;
  margin-right: 150px;
  margin-left: 80px;
}

content.text: Margin - Shorthand Property
To shorten the code, it is possible to specify all the margin properties in one property.
content.html: To shorten the code, it is possible to specify all the margin properties in one property.

content.text: The margin property is a shorthand property for the following individual margin properties:
content.html: The margin property is a shorthand property for the following individual margin properties:

content.text: So, here is how it works:
If the margin property has four values:

content.code_html:
p {
  margin: 25px 50px 75px 100px;
}

content.text: If the margin property has three values:

content.code_html:
p {
  margin: 25px 50px 75px;
}

content.text: If the margin property has two values:

content.code_html:
p {
  margin: 25px 50px;
}

content.text: If the margin property has one value:

content.code_html:
p {
  margin: 25px;
}

content.text: The auto Value
You can set the margin property to auto to horizontally center the element within its container.
content.html: You can set the margin property to auto to horizontally center the element within its container.

content.text: The element will then take up the specified width, and the remaining space will be split equally between the left and right margins.
content.html: The element will then take up the specified width, and the remaining space will be split equally between the left and right margins.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
div {  width: 300px;  margin: 
auto;  border: 1px solid red;}

width: 300px;  margin: 
auto;  border: 1px solid red;

content.code:
div {  width: 300px;  margin:
auto;  border: 1px solid red;}

syntax_highlighting.text:
div {  width: 300px;  margin: 
auto;  border: 1px solid red;}

width: 300px;  margin: 
auto;  border: 1px solid red;

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 300px;
  margin: auto;
  border: 1px solid red;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
div {  width: 300px;  margin: 
auto;  border: 1px solid red;}

width: 300px;  margin: 
auto;  border: 1px solid red;

content.text: The inherit Value

This example lets the left margin of the

element be inherited from the parent element (

):
content.html: This example lets the left margin of the <p class="ex1"> element be inherited from the parent element (<div>):

content.code_html:
div {
  border: 1px solid red;
  margin-left: 100px;
}

p.ex1 {
  margin-left: inherit;
}

content.text: All CSS Margin Properties

content.code_html:
Property Description
margin A shorthand property for setting all the margin properties in one declaration
margin-bottom Sets the bottom margin of an element
margin-left Sets the left margin of an element
margin-right Sets the right margin of an element
margin-top Sets the top margin of an element
